document.masterDocTitle: Records of the crangonid shrimp genus Pontocaris Bate, 1888 (Crustacea: Decapoda: Caridea) from Chinese waters, with notes on biology of P. pennata Bate, 1888

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 4. Distributions of
Pontocaris pennata
in the East and South China Seas in different seasons (January (winter); April (spring); July (summer); October (autumn)). The sizes of the dots indicate the quantities of specimens collected at different sampling stations.

subSubSection.paragraph: Distribution. Japan , East and South China Seas, Philippines , Indonesia , Loyalty Islands, New Caledonia , at depth of 70–812 meters.

Remarks. The specimens agree with the descriptions and illustrations of
De Man ( 1920 )
and
Chan ( 1996 )
. The present specimens mainly came from the depths of 100–200 meters.
Pontocaris sibogae
was previously recorded from the Chinese coastal water in the South China Sea by
Liu & Zhong ( 1994 )
. It was previously recorded from the East China Sea by
Chace ( 1984 )
and
Chan ( 1996 )
.
